result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Calendar call on November 29, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

Activity: Preliminary hearing and Arraignment 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

10:00 AM Prosecuting attorney Gerald Anthony Urbik appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant William Perry Stephens appeared by video.  Attorney Kelly James Mattingly appeared by video for William Perry Stephens. Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant's attorney, reading waived. Defendant's attorney stands mute, not guilty plea entered by Court, jury trial to be set. Bond to continue.
Preliminary hearing on July 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on June 15, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Activity: Inital Appearance
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

3:51 PM Defendant William Perry Stephens in court in custody by video with attorney Kelly James Mattingly and intern Olivia Long by video.  Alexander David Goulart appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.  $2750.00 signature bond set with conditions. Adjourn initial hearing June 15, 2022 at 1pm.

No contact directly or indirectly with victims R.M. or Q.E. his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Not to be within 100 feet of 1100 block of West Wall Street except if Defendant is on own property.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Not to possess any weapons, including firearms. Curfew from 7pm to 7am.   Court orders Level 2 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. If released must be on GPS monitoring.
